contentrichtext.text: [[File:DII-indiesstates.png|200px|thumb|Map of NCAA Division II Independents]] '''[[National Collegiate Athletic Association|NCAA]] Division II independent schools''' are four-year institutions that field intercollegiate teams in [[American football|football]] and other [[sports]], but which are not formally affiliated with any athletic conference. ==All-sports Independents== ===Provisional Division II member=== {| class="sortable wikitable" style="text-align:center;" !Institution !Location !Nickname !Founded !Type !Enrollment |- |[[South Dakota School of Mines and Technology]] <ref>http://athletics.sdsmt.edu/stories/94088/</ref> |[[Rapid City, South Dakota]] |[[South Dakota Mines Hardrockers|Hardrockers]] |1885 |Public |2,354 |} * '''Note''' South Dakota Mines will affiliate with the [[Great Northwest Athletic Conference]] in Men's Soccer for the 2013 season and in Football for the 2014 and 2015 seasons. <ref>http://www.gnacsports.com/football/news/2012-13/1435/gnac-to-add-south-dakota-mines-for-football-in-2014/</ref> ==Football-only Independents== ===Full Division II member=== {| class="sortable wikitable" style="text-align:center;" !Institution !Location !Nickname !Founded !Type !Enrollment !Primary<br>Conference |- |[[Alderson–Broaddus College]] |[[Philippi, West Virginia]] |[[Alderson–Broaddus Battlers|Battlers]] |1871 |Private |800 |[[Great Midwest Athletic Conference|G-MAC]] |- |[[University of North Carolina at Pembroke]] |[[Pembroke, North Carolina]] |[[UNC Pembroke Braves|Braves]] |1887 |Public |6,433 |[[Peach Belt Conference|Peach Belt]] |- |[[North Greenville University]]<sup>*<sup> |[[Tigerville, South Carolina]] |[[North Greenville Crusaders|Crusaders]] |1891 |Private |2,260 |[[Conference Carolinas]] |- |[[Oklahoma Panhandle State University]] |[[Goodwell, Oklahoma]] |[[Oklahoma Panhandle State Aggies|Aggies]] |1909 |Public |1,550 |[[Heartland Conference|Heartland]] |} * '''Note''' <sup>*</sup> - North Greenville has a "scheduling alliance" with the [[South Atlantic Conference]] for logistical purposes only. ===Future member=== {| class="sortable wikitable" style="text-align:center;" !Institution !Location !Nickname !Founded !Type !Enrollment !Joining !Primary<br>Conference |- |[[Limestone College]] |[[Gaffney, South Carolina]] |[[Limestone Saints|Saints]] |1845 |Private |3,300 |2014 |[[Conference Carolinas]] |} ===Exploratory Division II member=== {| class="sortable wikitable" style="text-align:center;" !Institution !Location !Nickname !Founded !Type !Enrollment !Primary<br>Conference |- |[[McMurry University]] |[[Abilene, Texas]] |[[McMurry War Hawks|War Hawks]] |1923 |Private |1,430 |[[Heartland Conference|Heartland]] |} ==Non-football Independents== ===Full Division II member=== {| class="sortable wikitable" style="text-align:center;" !Institution !Location !Nickname !Founded !Type !Enrollment |- |[[Bluefield State College]] |[[Bluefield, West Virginia]] |[[Bluefield State Big Blues|Big Blues]] (men's)<br>[[Bluefield State Lady Blues|Lady Blues]] (women's) |1895 |Public |1,800 |- |[[Oakland City University]] |[[Oakland City, Indiana]] |[[Oakland City Mighty Oaks|Mighty Oaks]] |1885 |Private |2,350 |- |[[Palm Beach Atlantic University]] |[[West Palm Beach, Florida]] |[[Palm Beach Atlantic Sailfish|Sailfish]] |1968 |Christian |3,260 |} ==References== {{Reflist}} {{NCAA Division II navbox}} {{NCAA Division II football conference navbox}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Ncaa Division Ii Independent Schools}} [[Category:NCAA Division II|Independents]]
